results.title: [Heart failure and vasopeptidase inhibitors].
results.text_hl: In the IMPRESS study, @CHEMICAL_omapatrilat @CHEMICAL_MESH:C106266 @@@omapatrilat@@@ has been evaluated in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Adrenal_Insufficiency</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000309 @@@cardiac insufficiency@@@ versus @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@; there was no significant difference on the principal outcome measure which was exercise tolerance, however it was significantly more effective than @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ on the outcome measure combining @DISEASE_Death @DISEASE_MESH:D003643 @@@death@@@ and hospital admission for deteriorating @<m>DISEASE_Adrenal_Insufficiency</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000309 @@@cardiac insufficiency@@@.

citations.NLM: Bareiss P, Ohlmann P, Roul G. [Heart failure and vasopeptidase inhibitors]. Arch Mal Coeur Vaiss. 2002 Feb;95 Spec 4(5 Spec 4):51-3. PMID: 11933558
citations.BibTeX: @article{11933558, title={[Heart failure and vasopeptidase inhibitors].}, author={Bareiss P and Ohlmann P and Roul G}, journal={Arch Mal Coeur Vaiss}, volume={95 Spec 4}, number={5 Spec 4}, pages={51-3}}

results.title: [Administration of maximal or median doses of drugs in cardiovascular diseases?].
results.text_hl: This applies e.g. to the study HOT with @CHEMICAL_Felodipine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D015736 @@@felodipine@@@ in @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ and @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Adrenal_Insufficiency</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000309 @@@cardiac insufficiency@@@ in the ATLAS study with @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ and the MERIT-HF study with @CHEMICAL_Metoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008790 @@@metoprolol@@@.

citations.NLM: Spácil J. [Administration of maximal or median doses of drugs in cardiovascular diseases?]. Vnitr Lek. 2003 Apr;49(4):322-5; discussion 326-7. PMID: 12793058
